intro: Corallodendron suberosum, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to Madagascar. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its dark, aromatic wood and simple, opposite leaves with a leathery texture. Its flowers are small and white or pale pink, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
